question: Operation of minor head  ‘107 – Cash Settlement Suspense Account ‘ below the Major Head  ‘8658 – Suspense Accounts ‘ for the settlement of inter-divisional transactions in Public Works Divisions has been discontinued w.e.f
Operation of CSSA for the settlement of inter-divisional transactions in Public Works Divisions has been replaced by
Accounting entry for indenting division when payment made for supply for store
option_a: Debit Stores/Service Advance under the Minor Head 799- Suspense below the functional Revenue or Capital Major/Sub-Major Heads concerned per contra credit to Sub-Head Public Works Cheques under the minor head  ‘102 – Public Works Remittances ‘ below the Major Head 8782
option_b: credit Stores/Service Advance under the Minor Head 799- Suspense below the functional Revenue or Capital Major/Sub-Major Heads concerned per contra debit to Sub-Head Public Works Cheques under the minor head 102 – Public Works Remittances ‘ below the Major Head  ‘8782
option_c: Debit Stores/Service Advance under the Minor Head 799 – Suspense below the functional Revenue or Capital Major/Sub-Major Heads concerned per contra credit to Minor Head 107-Cash Settlement Suspense Account below the Major Head 8658-Suspense Account.
option_d: credit Stores/Service Advance under the Minor Head 799 – Suspense below the functional Revenue or Capital Major/Sub-Major Heads concerned per contra debit to Minor Head 107-Cash Settlement Suspense Account below the Major Head 8658-Suspense Account.

question: Supplying Division on receipt of the cheque/draft towards supply of store from indenting division will
option_a: Debit to sub-head Stores supplied/Services rendered under the minor head 799-Suspense below the functional Major of Account concerned per contra Credit to 8782 - Cash Remittances etc.-102- Public Works Remittances-Remittances into Bank.
option_b: Minus Debit to sub-head Stores supplied/Services rendered under the minor head 799-Suspense below the functional Major of Account concerned per contra Debit to 8782 - Cash Remittances etc. - 102- Public Works Remittances- Remittances into Bank.
option_c: Debit Sub-head Stock under the minor head  ‘799 Suspense below the functional Major head concerned per contra Credit to 8782 - Cash Remittances etc.- 102- Public Works Remittances Remittances into Bank.
option_d: Minus Debit Sub-head Stock under the minor head  ‘799 Suspense below the functional Major head concerned per contra Debit to 8782 - Cash Remittances etc.- 102- Public Works Remittances Remittances into Bank.

question: After actual delivery of stores or rendition of services, Supplying Division will
option_a: Debit Sub-Head  ‘Stores supplied or Services rendered ‘ under the minor head  ‘799 – Suspense ‘ below the functional Major/Sub-Major head concerned by Credit (minus Debit) to Sub-head  ‘Stock ‘ under the minor head  ‘799 Suspense ‘ below the functional Major/Sub-Major head concerned.
option_b: Credit Sub-Head  ‘Stores supplied or Services rendered ‘ under the minor head  ‘799 – Suspense ‘ below the functional Major/Sub-Major head concerned by minus credit to Sub-head  ‘Stock ‘ under the minor head  ‘799 Suspense ‘ below the functional Major/Sub-Major head concerned.
option_c: Debit Sub-head Stock under the minor head  ‘799 Suspense below the functional Major head concerned per contra Credit to 8782 - Cash Remittances etc.- 102- Public Works Remittances Remittances into Bank.
option_d: Minus Debit Sub-head Stock under the minor head  ‘799 Suspense below the functional Major head concerned per contra Debit to 8782 - Cash Remittances etc.- 102- Public Works Remittances Remittances into Bank.

question: Excess Debit, if any, will be refunded to the Indenting Division
option_a: before the store is actually supplied
option_b: at the time of supplying the store
option_c: before the close of the monthly account in which store was supplied
option_d: before the close of financial year in which store was supplied

question: Pick the correct one
option_a: The invoice-cum-bill received from the Supplying Division, should be adjusted in the same month by the Indenting Division.
option_b: Adjustment is made by debiting the value of the invoice to Stock with a corresponding minus Debit to Sub-Head  ‘Store/Service Advance ‘ under the head of account to which the same stands debited originally.

question: Entry in the books of account of PAO on receipt of daily payment scroll together with paid cheque
option_a: Minus Debit 102-PW Remittance below 8782-Cash Remittance and Debit 108-PSB Suspense below 8658-Suspesne Account
option_b: Minus Credit 102-PW Remittance below 8782-Cash Remittance and Credit 108-PSB Suspense below 8658-Suspesne Account
option_c: Minus Credit 101-Central Civil below 8675-Deposit with Reserve Bank and Credit 108-PSB Suspense below 8658-Suspesne Account
option_d: Minus Debit 101-Central Civil below 8675-Deposit with Reserve Bank and Debit 108-PSB Suspense below 8658-Suspesne Account

question: Entry in the books of account of PAO on receipt of daily receipted scroll together with challan
option_a: Minus Debit 102-PW Remittance below 8782-Cash Remittance and Debit 108-PSB Suspense below 8658-Suspesne Account
option_b: Minus Credit 102-PW Remittance below 8782-Cash Remittance and Credit 108-PSB Suspense below 8658-Suspesne Account
option_c: Minus Credit 101-Central Civil below 8675-Deposit with Reserve Bank and Credit 108-PSB Suspense below 8658-Suspesne Account
option_d: Minus Debit 101-Central Civil below 8675-Deposit with Reserve Bank and Debit 108-PSB Suspense below 8658-Suspesne Account

question: On receipt of a copy of daily payment and receipted scroll in division action to be taken as
option_a: noting the amount in CPWA 51 in Part I and Part II for payment and receipted scroll respectively
option_b: noting the amount in CPWA 51 in Part II and Part I for payment and receipted scroll respectively
option_c: noting the amount in CAM 17 and 17A for payment and receipted scroll respectively
option_d: noting the amount in CAM 17A and 17 for payment and receipted scroll respectively

question: State whether true or false On receipt of daily Scroll together with paid cheque and receipted challan from Focal Point Branch of the accredited Bank, PAO after having verify the correctness of the scroll, enter the amount in Payments and receipt Column as the case may be of Form CAM-34 Register of P.S.
Clearance of minor head  ‘108 – Public Sector Bank Suspense ‘ below Major 8658-Suspense Accounts is made by the
option_b: Pay and Accounts Office of the Division concerned

question: Pick the correct one
option_a: Schedule of monthly reconciliation of Cheques and Remittances is prepared in Form CPWA 51
option_b: Form in CPWA 51 is maintained in two parts
option_c: Part I is Cash remitted and acknowledged ‘ and Part II is Cheques issued and paid

question: Clearance of minor head 108-Public Sector Bank Suspense is made by the Principal Accounts Office on receipt of
option_a: PAO wise Payment/Receipt Put through Statement from Reserve Bank of India
option_b: PAO wise Payment/Receipt Put through Statement from Controller General of Accounts.
option_c: PAO wise Payment/Receipt Put through Statement from Focal Point Branch of Accredited Bank
option_d: PAO wise Payment/Receipt Put through Statement from Zonal Pay and Accounts Office

question: Clearance of minor head 108-Public Sector Bank Suspense is made by the Principal Accounts Office by raising transfer entry in
On receipt of PAO wise  ‘Payment Put Through Statement ‘ from Reserve Bank of India, Principal Accounts Office will
On receipt of PAO wise  ‘Receipt Put Through Statement ‘ from Reserve Bank of India, Principal Accounts Office will
Minor Head 107-CSSA below the Major Head 8658-Suspense Accounts is now operated for settlement of inter-departmental transaction with
option_a: Cabinet Secretariat and Ministry of Defence
option_b: Cabinet Secretariat and Ministry of Home Affairs
option_c: Ministry of Defence and Ministry of Home Affairs
option_d: Cabinet Secretariat, Ministry of Defence and Ministry of Home Affairs
